title: James Cracknell's ex-wife gets candid on split from Strictly star
text:
Beverley Turner on marriage to James Cracknell: ‘It wasn’t a life I wanted to live anymore’ (Picture: BBC/ITV)

Beverley Turner, the ex-wife of Olympic Gold medalist James Cracknell appeared on Lorraine this morning and opened up about her painful divorce from the Strictly Come Dancing star.

Turmer opened up about the realities of being married to a sportsman, and revealed her marriage left her isolate and alone whilst her husband was away competing and training.

‘That single-minded determination [of a sportman] can be amazing and achieve incredible things,’ she told Lorraine. ‘But it does mean you can sit on a beach on your own [while they are off training]. Which is hard. It wasn’t really a life I wanted to live anymore.’

When asked by Lorraine Kelly about her relationship with Cracknell now, the former television presenter said that she was ‘glad’ her ex had found a new partner who hadn’t known him prior to a horror bike crash in America 10 years ago, which left the sportsman with brain damage.

‘We don’t know how the brain works,’ Turner said, who also trained as a psychotherapist. ‘But James injured his frontal lobe, which controls your personality. The great thing is he’s met somebody who didn’t know him before the crash.’

Beverley described how her ex-husband was ‘different’ following a bike crash 10 years ago. (Picture: ITV)

Turner explained that post-crash she was ‘constantly looking for the first version [of Cracknell] and finding the differences.’

‘If you know him, you think he’s different.’ she shared. ‘And a bit scruffy. And he can’t dance!’

The Taste anchorwoman also couldn’t resist a cheeky dig or two at her former partner whilst sat on Lorraine’s sofa.

Turner said Cracknell poked fun at his Strictly appearence on Lorraine: ‘put a shirt on!’ (Picture: ITV)

The mother-of-three told Lorraine that sometimes she and Cracknell want to ‘hire an assassin and take each other out’.

She also had a few choice words about Cracknell’s appearence on Lorraine following his elimination as the first contestant on this year’s Strictly Come Dancing.

‘He looked really scruffy,’ she said. ‘Put a shirt on and stand up straight!’

Lorraine airs weekdays from 8.30am on ITV.
